locutie.beschrijving: The sermon uses the metaphor of jazz to trace the biblical narrative of liberation, from the midwives in Egypt to the resurrection, framing the Gospel as a recurring theme with endless variations.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher connects disparate texts (Exodus, Hannah, Mary, Paul) through a consistent thematic lens of 'defiance and gratitude'.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher acts as a 'curator of the song,' inviting the audience to recognize their place in a historical rhythm of grace.
voorbeelden: I tell it to you for one reason only...
Consider your own call, brothers and sisters
Shame on us, church

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from anxiety/settledness to a state of 'Easter laughter' and 'unafraid' defiance of modern Pharaohs.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The 'force' and 'beat' serve as metaphors for the Spirit's movement, though the Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: Jazz arises among the disadvantaged.
The song is testimony to the one who comes to save.
The world is going to die in its strength.
Consider your call.
Listen once more to the beat.
Sing to the Lord.
It required considerable anguish...
I will see if that is enough...
Shame on us.
I will give you rest.
He will again have compassion.
He will reign forever.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but largely quoted from scripture rather than formulated as a direct 'I promise you' from the preacher.

voorbeelden: Finé!—end of empire.
It is adequate!
The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the authority of the 'Song' to declare the end of the old world, though it often remains in the third person.

indicatoren: Long lists of biblical quotes (Section III) that 'talk about' the song rather than 'singing' it to the hearer.
Metaphorical analysis of jazz as a concept.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a beautiful musical-theological tradition rather than a participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct sacramental address ('Today, this promise is for you')
First-person performative verbs ('I declare to you')

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promises are mediated through biblical characters (Hannah, Mary, Paul) rather than the preacher's direct illocution.
voorbeelden: The promise of the Lord proves true.
He will again have compassion upon us.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Self-deprecating introduction ('aging white guy') and collective 'we' in the conclusion.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct challenge in Section IV ('If you think you are smart...').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used more for indictment (Directive) than for comfort (Commissive).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the 'disadvantaged', 'Pharaoh', 'the women', and 'the jazz artists'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'gallery of heroes' effect, keeping the action in the past or in the abstract.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Biblical history and the history of jazz.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Generalizations about jazz and the nature of the Gospel.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Shame on us' and 'Consider your call' sections.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The transition from the beauty of the song (Assertive) to 'Shame on us' (Directive/Expressive) risks moralism.
voorbeelden: All good news. But now a sober thought... we nickel and dime.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'but' cancels the performative power of the grace just described.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The ending returns to the Commissive/Declarative through the quote of Lamentations.
voorbeelden: It is adequate! ... The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The use of 'It is adequate!' acts as a declarative seal on the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because the horse... he has thrown in the sea... Sing to the Lord!
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We have been singing the song forever... What has happened to this dear people... we nickel and dime.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant 'lecture-sermon' that describes the performative nature of the Gospel without fully becoming the performance itself until the very final lines.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Jazz arises among the disadvantaged who cannot afford to have things settled.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a powerful imaginative framework for the Gospel.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Section III is almost entirely a list of 'talking about' other people's songs.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The preacher stops preaching and starts quoting.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an event of 're-imagining' but less an event of 'encounter'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher points to the sacrament ('treasured in word and sacrament') but stays at the level of signifier.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the 'Other One' who is the subject of the song, but rarely the direct speaker in the sermon's present moment.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a 'lead-footed' witness rather than a mandatory herald.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the way scripture is heard and played.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is left to the 'resilience of the beat'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon functions as a 'reminder' of grace rather than the 'delivery' of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong in the description of the midwives.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 3rd person past tense verbs (did, sang, was). Needs more 2nd person present (is for you, frees you).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The song is testimony to the one who comes to save.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: This song is God saving you right now.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are kept within the 'quotation marks' of biblical characters.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Break the quotation marks and address the congregation directly with the promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: Today, God throws your Pharaoh into the sea.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'aging white guy' persona creates a distance of 'observation'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Shift from 'I know three things' to 'The Word declares to us'.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the babies in the barrio being danced to life.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'Shame on us' section creates a legalistic dip.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the 'Shame' in the 'Surprise' of grace rather than a list of failures.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and theologically sound, but it functions more as a 'theology of the sermon' than a 'sacramental event'. By shifting from 'talking about the song' to 'singing the song to the hearer', the performative power would be unlocked.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' as a white man; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Word to end empires.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade the hearer of the jazz metaphor; SAT seeks to make the 'newness' happen through the speaking.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'Constative Surplus' (the long list of quotes) actually stalls the 'event' by turning the hearer into a student of biblical musicology.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The horse and the rider he has thrown in the sea.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - it defines the reality of the Gospel.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'locutionary' beauty of the jazz metaphor, which is effective but risks overshadowing the 'illocutionary' act of proclamation.
